bibl.title: Despatch from Ezekiel E. Smith to George L. Rives, October 1, 1888
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

div1.p: Consulate General, U. S. A. Monrovia, Oct. 1st, 1888
Mr. Ezekiel E. Smith To the Deartment of State.
Returns and accounts for the quarter ended Sept. 30th, 1888.
Consulate General, U. S. A. Monrovia, Liberia, Oct. 1st 1888
Honorable George L. Rives Assistant Secretary of State, Wasington, D. C.

Sir: I have the honor respectfully to forward the returns and accounts of this Consulate General, as follows: digest of invoice book 1; arrival and departures of American vessels 2; record of treasury fees 3; summary of business for the quarter 4; record of notarial services 5;
I mailed the report, of the Agent at Elmina, GOld Goast Colony, some days since, to you. I have not heard from any other of the Agents in this Consular District.
I am, sir, your obedient servant.
Ezekiel E. Smith U.S. Consul General.
